meanings.definition: A small, thin strip of wood used in traditional Southwestern architecture for ceiling or wall covering.
meanings.sent1: The latilla was carefully placed on the ceiling to create a rustic look.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter nailed the latilla to the wall to add a touch of Southwestern style.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the latilla as a balance beam in the old adobe house.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed off the latilla-covered walls, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The scent of pine lingered on the latilla, bringing nature indoors.

meanings.definition: To cover a ceiling or wall with latillas.
meanings.sent1: They decided to latilla the entire room for a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: We will latilla the ceiling next weekend for a fresh new look.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully pretended to latilla the walls with imaginary wood strips.
meanings.sent4: His words latillaed the room with a sense of calm and reassurance.
meanings.sent5: The music latillaed the air, filling the space with harmonious melodies.

meanings.definition: A decorative element in Southwestern architecture made of latillas.
meanings.sent1: The latilla design above the doorway added a touch of elegance to the adobe house.
meanings.sent2: The intricate latilla patterns on the walls showcased the craftsmanship of the builders.
meanings.sent3: The latilla ornament swayed gently in the breeze, catching the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a latilla, brightening up the room with its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The latilla motif on the ceiling told a story of tradition and artistry.
